communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any policy manual, employee procedure manual, or folder of collected policies which guide police operations. 

The original format of the documents is acceptable (i.e. PDF, doc, .txt, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Barr

title: DeKalb County Jail Emergency Evacuation Plan (Dekalb County Sheriff)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting documents surrounding the DeKalb County Jail's emergency evacuation plan. My request applies to records maintained by or within the possession, custody or control
of DeKalb County, including, but not limited to, the DeKalb County Sheriff's Office and the DeKalb County Police Department as well as any authorized sub-entity, agent, vendor or contractor. All guides, manuals, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and other written policies, procedures or directives related to emergency evacuations of the people incarcerated in the jail in the event of fire, flooding, disease, or any other disaster, including all interim, draft or superseded versions, are included in this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Riley

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Auror
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All emails and email notifications sent or received by agency personnel that include the domain "@auror.co". This includes but is not limited to notifications of incident reports, evidence exports, event updates, and other communications generated by the Auror software.
2. All exported reports generated by the Auror software. This includes reports exported in any format (PDF, HTML, JSON, etc.) and covers all types of reports such as evidence reports, incident reports, 3. All incident of investigative reports mentioning or involving the Auror software. This includes any reports or records where the Auror software was used to document, track, or investigate incidents.
4.  SOW, contracts, MOU, user manuals or technical documentation regarding the Auror platform. 

To assist with locating these records, the Auror software is a platform used for tracking, monitoring, and managing various incidents and retail crime investigations. It includes functionalities for exporting reports and sending email notifications.

Responsive documents should be from 1/1/2020 until the date this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Lisa Tate trespassing at 4060 Shenandoah Ave, 63110 8/21/21

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Lisa Tate trespassing at 4060 Shenandoah Ave, 63110 8/21/21
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the 911 calls, body cam footage, police reports and any other pertinent information on an incident regarding Lisa Tate trying to forcibly take Amy Blessing’s son at 4060 Shenandoah Ave, St. Louis, MO 63110 that took place 8/21/2021 around 1:30 PM

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Amy Blessing

 Your Login ID is:  170254-72451696@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXYtGC6Oin9YiVC4XVqAq51XRzrtojgLNC9VX-2B10tFUPXVusxxgVpqSDZoePeCTRR668XYawChRik6-2Ftj6-2FEkeow-3DQQfA_Lg-2F5XXetdt0DxBMPLjhg0-2B9jRGfkyGzvOOmIe0hsTMsokbTs2K5Dok4Jjk3WuhDjOljDBG6jTe8GppIj4MkYoY7Tu4-2BGrvEMwrtgsdIOFT4RGWkKEf-2FxBBp0zRikPi3DJ-2FqYsoMIiiibaIeUR52LN1PJIGDxU1JfxOVoJXl6bpPo55t8wOWq3M5Dovow1-2BtrMGFkFjyomFk2Srp83eIaGu1KFJsyMkLOYpf50wTtCbg-3D)

communications.subject: SLMPD - Public Records Request :: P021460-072624
communications.communication:
Dear Amy Blessing: 
Thank you for submitting a records request to the St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department.  Your request was given reference number P021460-072624, for tracking purposes. Type of Records Selected: Other Police Record Complaint Number (if applicable): Type of Incident (if applicable): Description of Request (if applicable):   To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the 911 calls, body cam footage, police reports and any other pertinent information on an incident regarding Lisa Tate trying to forcibly take Amy Blessing’s son at 4060 Shenandoah Ave, St. Louis, MO 63110 that took place 8/21/2021 around 1:30 PM

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Amy Blessing

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fst-louis-metropolitan-police-department-671%252Flisa-tate-trespassing-at-4060-shenandoah-ave-63110-82121-170254%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAj9WsQ4FuNTZD2Y9DnVAucV28%3A1sXE5Z%3AbjbItGjm_fVO2zJhBmxRGtKaFwsXvS7S4V8BS94Xevs 
We are currently reviewing your request and will contact you if any additional information is required.  Otherwise, we will proceed with locating and gathering responsive records from various departments.  Once records are located, they will need to be reviewed to determine what may be released at this time.  All records are released in accordance with the Missouri Sunshine Law, Chapter 610 and SLMPD Policy. 
There will be a cost associated with this request, and you will be contacted with more details prior to records being released.  The earliest records are typically available is as follows: 
• Arrest Reports, Background Checks, Crash Reports, Police Calls for Service, Law Enforcement Requests and Non-criminal Police Reports are available within 10 days of submission of your request. 
• Criminal Police Reports, evidentiary material and other non-standard requests are available within 30 days of submission. 
In the event your request will require additional time you will be provided with a detailed explanation of any further delay. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
Thank you!

title: Department of Energy Comms 10 Gas Turbines and Renewable Goal

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Department of Energy Comms 10 Gas Turbines and Renewable Goal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports show that the Puerto Rico Energy Bureau has approved 10 natural gas turbines across Puerto Rico: https://www.elvocero.com/gobierno/aprobadas-10-nuevas-turbinas-con-gas-metano/article_07c5c64a-4a05-11ef-b5c7-77ec869aba6f.html

Reports show that New Fortress Energy, parent company of Genera PR, has breached their gas contact before: https://periodismoinvestigativo.com/2022/09/new-fortress-breaches-contract-on-gas-supply-puerto-ricos-government-allows-it/

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Communications, emails, messages, and attachments sent between the Department of Energy (DOE) and Genera PR concerning the approval of permits for these 10 natural gas turbines and how it correlates with Puerto Rico's renewable energy law, which requires 100% renewable energy by 2050. To aid in your search, Genera PR employees emails likely all end with "@generapr.com." It is likely that these potential communications were sent from either the Office of Electricity, Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy, Office of Fossil Energy and Carbon Management, the Federal Energy Management Program, Office of State and Community Energy Programs, or the Grid Deployment Office.

2) Communications, emails, messages, and attachments sent between the DOE and New Fortress Energy concerning the approval of permits for these 10 natural gas turbines and how it correlates with Puerto Rico's renewable energy law, which requires 100% renewable energy by 2050. To aid in your search, New Fortress Energy employee emails likely all end with "@newfortressenergy.com."  It is likely that these potential communications were sent from either the Office of Electricity, Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy, Office of Fossil Energy and Carbon Management, the Federal Energy Management Program, Office of State and Community Energy Programs, or the Grid Deployment Office.

3) Communications, emails, messages, and attachments sent between the DOE and the Puerto Rico Energy Bureau (Negociado de Energy de Puerto Rico) concerning the approval of permits for these 10 natural gas turbines and how it correlates with Puerto Rico's renewable energy law, which requires 100% renewable energy by 2050. To aid in your search, PREB employee emails likely all end with "@energia.pr.gov."  It is likely that these potential communications were sent from either the Office of Electricity, Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy, Office of Fossil Energy and Carbon Management, the Federal Energy Management Program, Office of State and Community Energy Programs, or the Grid Deployment Office.

3) Communications, emails, messages, and attachments sent between the DOE and the Puerto Rican government (including the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority (PREPA))  concerning the approval of permits for these 10 natural gas turbines and how it correlates with Puerto Rico's renewable energy law, which requires 100% renewable energy by 2050. It is likely that these potential communications were sent from either the Office of Electricity, Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy, Office of Fossil Energy and Carbon Management, the Federal Energy Management Program, Office of State and Community Energy Programs, or the Grid Deployment Office. To aid in your search, PREPA employees email addresses end with "@prepar.pr.gov"

4) Documents, presentations, reports and informative material concerning the guidelines that regiment the approval of natural gas terminals and turbines in the United States and Puerto Rico, as well as how those approvals have to comply with local or state laws concerning renewable energy directives. In particular, I am searching for anything that specifically mentions the "Puerto Rico Energy Public Policy Act" also known as "Law 17-2019."

5) Any documents, presentations, reports and informative material concerning an investigation into how Puerto Rico is complying with it's renewable energy goals as stated within the "Puerto Rico Energy Public Policy Act" also known as "Law 17-2019." Please include any documentation about enforcement actions or penalties relating to renewable goals.

Keywords: "Genera PR," "New Fortress Energy," "Puerto Rico Energy Bureau," "Negociado de Energy de Puerto Rico" "natural gas turbine," "turbine permit," "natural gas permit" "PREPA" PR100" puerto rico renewable" "Puerto Rico Energy Public Policy Act" "Law 17-2019"

I am requesting records between January 1, 2024 and the date this request is processed.

These records are not being made for a commercial purpose. I am a freelance journalist and these records will be used in the course of reporting about the energy crisis in Puerto Rico.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Rexvill Raid
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports reportedly show a raid on members of the protest group Campamento Resistencia: https://x.com/icyberpr/status/1652919559240790017

I have uploaded a document that purports to be the search and seizure warrant signed by the Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan on April 30, 2023 at 11:42pm. The document cites 18 U.S. Code § 2101(a)(1), 18 U.S. Code § 371, and 18 U.S. Code § 231 as justification for the warrant. The location listed for the raid is Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959. Reportedly, the raid was conducted on or about May 1, 2023.

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Any interagency communications, emails, messages, and attachments concerning a raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

2) Any communications, emails, messages, and attachments between the DHS and other law enforcement agencies concerning a raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

3) Any after-action reports, memos, directives or presentations created in the aftermath of the raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

4) A copy of the search and seizure warrant used during the raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

Keywords: "Rexville," "Jeremiah Green" "SA Green" "campamento resistencia" "riot" "search warrant" "Judge Morgan" "Bayamon" "Bayamón"

The request is for all records between April 1, 2023 and December 31, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports reportedly show a raid on members of the protest group Campamento Resistencia: https://x.com/icyberpr/status/1652919559240790017

I have uploaded a document that purports to be the search and seizure warrant signed by the Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan on April 30, 2023 at 11:42pm. The document cites 18 U.S. Code § 2101(a)(1),  18 U.S. Code § 371, and 18 U.S. Code § 231 as justification for the warrant. The location listed for the raid is Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959. Reportedly, the raid was conducted on or about May 1, 2023.

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) Any interagency communications, emails, messages, and attachments concerning a raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

2) Any communications, emails, messages, and attachments between the FBI and other law enforcement agencies concerning a raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

3) Any after-action reports, memos, directives or presentations created in the aftermath of the raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

4) A copy of the search and seizure warrant used by the FBI during the raid on Urbanizacion Rexville Calle 34 BF-11 Bayamón, Puerto Rico 00959 on or around May 1, 2023.

Keywords: "Rexville," "Jeremiah Green" "SA Green" "campamento resistencia" "riot" "search warrant" "Judge Morgan" "Bayamon" "Bayamón"

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The request is for all records between April 1, 2023 and December 31, 2023.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am an independent journalist and any records from this request will be used in the course of reporting about Puerto Rico.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am limiting my request to the free two hours of searching and 100 duplicated
pages. I am not willing to pay additional fees.

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    Please See attachment for description.

**

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: Distribution of Consumer Credits unaccounted for (United States Attorney General Marrick Garland)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Distribution of Consumer Credits unaccounted for (United States Attorney General Marrick Garland)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, Truth in Lending Act, Fair Credit Reporting Act, Regulation CC, Regulation D, Bank Secrecy Act, Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 18 USC 8, Public Law 73-10 of 1933, 17 CFR 240.10(b)5, Modern Money Mechanics by the Chicago Federal Reserve 1961-62, 2 Corinthians 8:12-15 and Title 15 of the United States Code 1692, I hereby request records showing what happened to the credits for a consumer credit transaction pursuant to Certified Mail # 9505 5111 5323 4131 6449 31 have been teransferred to:
1. Registered INTERNATIONAL BILL OF EXCHANGE #MIR-196308311014-IBOE,
2. FS FORM 231, FS FORM 232, SF 24, SF25, SF25A, SF28, SF275, SF1414, SF 1415, SF 1416, SF 1418, OF 90 AND OF 91,
3. Credits transferred, deposited, wired, tendered, issued, etc.
4. Records regarding the movement or issuing of credits for the Consumer Credit Transactions associated with Registered Mail documents RE 212 352 257 US and RE 212 352 243 US

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

MARK IRVIN RITCHIE

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Distribution of Consumer Credits unaccounted for (Internal Revenue Service, Criminal Investigation Division)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, Truth in Lending Act, Fair Credit Reporting Act, Regulation CC, Regulation D, Bank Secrecy Act, Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 18 USC 8, Public Law 73-10 of 1933, 17 CFR 240.10(b)5, Modern Money Mechanics by the Chicago Federal Reserve 1961-62, 2 Corinthians 8:12-15 and Title 15 of the United States Code 1692, I hereby request records showing what happened to the credits for a consumer credit transaction pursuant to Certified Mail # 9505 5111 5323 4131 6449 31 have been teransferred to:
1. Registered INTERNATIONAL BILL OF EXCHANGE #MIR-196308311014-IBOE,
2. FS FORM 231, FS FORM 232, SF 24, SF25, SF25A, SF28, SF275, SF1414, SF 1415, SF 1416, SF 1418, OF 90 AND OF 91,
3. Credits transferred, deposited, wired, tendered, issued, etc.
4. Records regarding the movement or issuing of credits for the Consumer Credit Transactions associated with Registered Mail documents RE 212 352 257 US and RE 212 352 243 US

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

MARK IRVIN RITCHIE

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Communications with City of Seattle
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications, including but not limited to emails, text messages, and instant messages, between SCORE employees and the Seattle Mayor's Office and Seattle City Attorney's Office since September 1, 2023, including attachments and associated metadata.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse
